description: The Supreme Court is actively incorporating the voices of Radhika Vemula and Abeda Salim Tadvi into the UGC's regulatory framework, addressing campus discrimination. The court directed the UGC to consider their suggestions, focusing on accountability, redressal, and mental health support. These suggestions aim to prevent discrimination and ensure equal opportunity, with penalties for institutional negligence.

Vijay’s TVK slams Shah for Hindi 'imposition'; terms it against federalism
description: Actor Vijay's Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) has strongly condemned Union Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks promoting Hindi, viewing it as an imposition that undermines federalism. The party argues that prioritizing Hindi in government administration disregards the nation's linguistic diversity and goes against the spirit of inclusivity. TVK urges Shah to retract his statement emphasizing Hindi's role in a self-reliant India.

title: 'Go beyond traditional war concept': Rajnath to forces; flags 'unconventional threats'
description: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, addressing the Combined Commanders’ Conference 2025, urged the Armed Forces to prepare for modern warfare, including information and biological threats. He emphasized technology adoption and self-reliance, calling for a 'Sudarshan Chakra' strategy. Singh highlighted the 'JAI' mantra (Jointness, Aatmanirbharta, Innovation) for military modernization and cited Operation Sindoor as an example of India's growing indigenous capabilities.

description: Pakistan's Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar acknowledged India's refusal of third-party mediation for the ceasefire established on May 10. Dar stated that India insists on bilateral talks, a stance reiterated during a meeting in Washington. He emphasized Pakistan's openness to dialogue, while noting India's reluctance.

description: The Kansas City Chiefs faced backlash after players wore "Free 4" shirts supporting Rashee Rice, suspended for a high-speed crash that injured four. Fans and analysts criticized the team's public display of loyalty, deeming it tone-deaf given the severity of Rice's actions and his initial lack of remorse. The incident sparked a public relations nightmare, overshadowing the game itself.

Rs 579.06 crore! Apollo Tyre to sponsor Indian team; outbid Canva, JK Cement
description: Apollo Tyres has secured the Indian cricket team's jersey sponsorship until 2027, committing approximately Rs 4.5 crores per game, surpassing Dream11's previous rate. The deal encompasses around 130 fixtures. Canva and JK Cement were also in contention, while Birla Optus Paints showed interest but avoided bidding. Dream11's exit was triggered by the government's online gaming regulations.

'I love you two': LeBron James’ mother pens emotional message for her son
description: LeBron James and Savannah James recently celebrated their 12th wedding anniversary, prompting an emotional message from LeBron's mother, Gloria James. Gloria expressed her love and blessings for the couple, who are parents to Bronny, Bryce Maximus, and Zhuri Nova.

title: Asia Cup row: BJP targets Rahul over Afridi's remarks; Cong hits back with old pic
description: The Asia Cup handshake controversy escalated after India skipped the customary exchange with Pakistan, drawing political reactions. Shahid Afridi criticised PM Modi, praising Rahul Gandhi, while BJP's Amit Malviya questioned Gandhi's loyalties. The PCB filed a complaint with the ICC, alleging misconduct by the match referee, and threatened withdrawal from the Asia Cup 2025.

Class 10 exams twice a year: Sports students covered under May session; no separate paper
description: Beginning in 2026, the CBSE will accommodate student-athletes under the new two-board-exam system for Class 10. The sports exam accommodation aligns with the second board exam in May, addressing date clashes between sporting events and academic assessments. This provision ensures students can manage both sports and studies effectively, with re-exams available if needed.

description: Neeraj Chopra begins his World Championship title defence, facing strong rivals like Arshad Nadeem and Julian Weber. The competition features a historic four Indian athletes. Chopra aims to join an elite group of javelin throwers, while Weber enters as a favourite based on current form. The anticipated Chopra-Nadeem clash is set for the final round.

Google AI layoffs: AI contractors asked to leave; workers claim no warning given
description: Google has reportedly laid off over 200 AI contractors amidst disputes over pay and working conditions. These contractors, employed by firms like GlobalLogic, were crucial in training AI models like Gemini. Workers allege the layoffs are retaliation for unionization efforts and concerns about job security, with some filing complaints with the National Labor Relations Board.

title: Nasa’s Guardian detects tsunami: 30-minute early warning; a space-based breakthrough
description: In July 2025, NASA's Guardian system detected a tsunami triggered by a massive earthquake near Kamchatka. Utilizing atmospheric disturbances and GNSS signals, Guardian issued alerts up to 30 minutes before landfall. This experimental technology enhances traditional warning systems, offering near-real-time, global monitoring and marking a significant advancement in disaster preparedness.

Two-thirds of Americans link harsh political talk to violence: Poll
description: A recent Reuters poll reveals that a significant majority of Americans believe harsh political rhetoric is fueling violence, following the death of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. The poll highlights concerns about eroded tolerance, a sense of societal breakdown, and fears of politically motivated violence. There's also a disparity in media attention given to different incidents of political violence.

Maharashtra local body polls: Hold elections by January, orders SC
description: The Supreme Court has mandated the Maharashtra government and State Election Commission to conduct local body elections by January 31, 2026. The court has instructed authorities to complete the delimitation exercise by October 10 this year.

'No confusion': Tejashwi says CM face to be named at 'right time'; cites 'people's mandate'
description: Tejashwi Yadav, amidst his 'Bihar Adhikar Yatra,' asserted the Mahagathbandhan alliance faces no confusion regarding its chief ministerial candidate for the upcoming Bihar assembly election. He emphasized that the people of Bihar desire change and will ultimately decide who leads the state.

Delhi BMW crash explained: What happened that day - in graphics
description: A BMW crash in Delhi's Dhaula Kuan resulted in the death of finance ministry official Navjot Singh and critically injured his wife, Sandeep Kaur. Gaganpreet Makkad, the alleged driver, has been arrested and faces charges including culpable homicide. Kaur alleges Makkad delayed medical assistance, leading to further investigation into the circumstances surrounding the incident and the subsequent care provided.

title: Mother Dairy price cut: Revised rates effective from Sept 22
description: Mother Dairy will reduce prices on most value-added dairy and processed food products starting September 22, 2025, passing on 100% of the GST benefits to consumers. This decision follows the GST Council's rationalization of tax slabs, aiming to boost consumption and make packaged foods more affordable.

title: 'Masood Azhar's family torn into pieces': JeM commander's big admission on Op Sindoor
description: Jaish-e-Mohammad commander Masood Ilyas Kashmiri admitted in a video that India's Operation Sindoor severely impacted Maulana Masood Azhar's family. The strike on May 7 targeted terror infrastructure in Bahawalpur, JeM's headquarters, following the deadly Pahalgam attack where 26 civilians were killed. India retaliated by destroying major terror hubs and air infrastructure across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: Road rage kidnapping: Puja Khedkar's dad was in SUV; mother unleashed dogs to scare cops
